decks.notes: The focal point of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy by utilizing powerful Golgari creatures and removal spells. The deck focuses on ramping up mana with Llanowar Elves and then playing high-impact threats like Wildgrowth Walker, Jadelight Ranger, and Carnage Tyrant. The deck also includes key removal spells like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt to deal with opposing threats. The goal is to outpace the opponent and apply pressure to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this Jeskai Control deck is to slow down and control the game through the use of counter spells and removal cards. The deck focuses on card advantage and board control with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, Deafening Clarion, Settle the Wreckage, and Seal Away. It also includes a small burn package with cards like Fight with Fire and Expansion/Explosion to finish off the opponent. The deck aims to effectively disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage and eventually winning through a combination of removal, control, and burn spells.

The key focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures. The strategy involves playing aggressive and efficient creatures like Adanto Vanguard and Emmara, Soul of the Accord, while leveraging cards like Conclave Tribunal and History of Benalia for removal and value generation. The deck also aims to go wide with cards like Saproling Migration and March of the Multitudes, while utilizing cards like Venerated Loxodon and Trostani Discordant for token buffs and lifegain. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure and close out the game quickly through a combination of creature synergy and powerful spells.

The deck focuses on employing aggressive, low-cost creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes a combination of efficient creatures like Adanto Vanguard, Skymarcher Aspirant, and Benalish Marshal, along with powerful anthems like Venerated Loxodon and Heroic Reinforcements to buff the team and deal massive damage. The deck also includes cards like History of Benalia and Conclave Tribunal for additional board presence and removal options. The mana base is built around white, with a splash of red for additional reach and consistency.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Carnage Tyrant, Jadelight Ranger, and Llanowar Elves, while using cards like Wildgrowth Walker and Midnight Reaper to maintain card advantage and board presence. The deck also includes removal spells like Ravenous Chupacabra and Vraska's Contempt to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Karn, Scion of Urza and Vivien Reid provides additional card advantage and utility. Find / Finality serves as a versatile card for both creature recursion and board wipe.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures like Crackling Drake and Enigma Drake, while protecting them with spells like Dive Down and Spell Pierce. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and mana efficiency with cards like Chart a Course and Opt, while also removing threats with Lava Coil and Shock. Niv-Mizzet, Parun and Murmuring Mystic provide additional win conditions and Search for Azcanta helps with card selection. The deck is mana efficient with a mix of Islands, Mountains, and dual lands.

The main idea of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a strong and aggressive creature presence while disrupting their strategy with removal spells and enchantments. Cards like Adanto Vanguard, Lyra Dawnbringer, and Rekindling Phoenix provide a powerful offensive and defensive threat, while Tocatli Honor Guard shuts down certain creature abilities. History of Benalia helps to generate additional creatures, and cards like Lava Coil and Justice Strike provide removal options. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence and maintain pressure on the opponent to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with cards like Llanowar Elves, Wildgrowth Walker, and Merfolk Branchwalker, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with removal spells like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt. The deck aims to generate card advantage with cards like Midnight Reaper and Vivien Reid, and finish off opponents with big creatures like Carnage Tyrant. The deck also utilizes graveyard recursion with cards like Memorial to Folly and Find / Finality to outvalue opponents in the late game.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with quick and aggressive creatures like Crackling Drake, Enigma Drake, and Arclight Phoenix. The deck utilizes spells like Crash Through, Warlord's Fury, and Maximize Velocity to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Card draw and selection is crucial with Chart a Course and Opt to keep the momentum going. The deck also includes some removal options like Shock and Beacon Bolt to clear the way for attacking. Overall, the deck aims to win as quickly as possible by playing aggressively and efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using creatures with strong abilities and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Llanowar Elves and Merfolk Branchwalker to ramp up mana and card draw, combined with powerful creatures like Carnage Tyrant and Midnight Reaper, the deck aims to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Ravenous Chupacabra helps to deal with threats from the opponent, while cards like Find / Finality provide versatility and options for different game states.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with aggressive creatures like Crackling Drake and Enigma Drake, while providing protection with cards like Dive Down and Spell Pierce. The deck utilizes card draw and selection spells like Chart a Course and Opt to maintain momentum and fuel the powerful abilities of Niv-Mizzet, Parun. Removal spells such as Lava Coil and Shock help control the board and keep the opponent on the defensive. The mana base efficiently supports the deck's spells and allows for consistent casting of threats.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The deck focuses on creating an army of creatures quickly, using cards like Adanto Vanguard, Emmara, Soul of the Accord, and Venerated Loxodon. These creatures are supported by cards like March of the Multitudes and History of Benalia to strengthen the board presence. Conclave Tribunal provides removal options, while Ajani, Adversary of Tyrants offers additional support. The deck aims to establish an early advantage and maintain pressure to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly building a powerful board presence with efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Merfolk Branchwalker. Wildgrowth Walker and Midnight Reaper provide card advantage while also pressuring the opponent. Jadelight Ranger and Carnage Tyrant are key threats that are difficult to deal with, and Vraska's Contempt can handle problematic creatures. Find / Finality provides versatility for card advantage or board clear. Doom Whisperer adds a strong finisher option. The mana base is optimized for consistent performance, with options like Memorial to Folly and Detection Tower for added utility.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate powerful threats like Enigma Drake, Crackling Drake, and Niv-Mizzet, Parun, while controlling the board with cheap removal spells like Lava Coil and Shock. This aggressive strategy is supported by card draw spells like Chart a Course and Opt to maintain card advantage. Dive Down and Spell Pierce protect your key creatures from removal spells, while Search for Azcanta helps you find the cards you need. The mana base is optimized for casting your spells on curve and maximizing the effectiveness of your powerful threats.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Adanto Vanguard and Thorn Lieutenant, supported by strong enchantments like History of Benalia. The deck aims to apply early pressure on the opponent and maintain control of the battlefield with cards like Conclave Tribunal and Ajani, Adversary of Tyrants. The mana base is designed to consistently cast creatures and spells on curve, allowing the deck to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible by utilizing aggressive red creatures, burn spells, and powerful finishers. By utilizing cards like Dire Fleet Daredevil and Goblin Chainwhirler early on, followed by Siege-Gang Commander and Rekindling Phoenix for additional pressure, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. Cards like Banefire and Treasure Map provide additional reach and card advantage, ensuring that the aggression continues until the opponent is defeated.

This deck focuses on aggressive early game plays with efficient creatures like Jadelight Ranger and Merfolk Branchwalker to pressure the opponent. It also utilizes cards like Wildgrowth Walker and Midnight Reaper to gain value from creature deaths. Carnage Tyrant serves as a powerful late-game threat that is difficult for opponents to deal with. The deck includes removal spells like Ravenous Chupacabra and Vraska's Contempt to handle opposing threats. Vivien Reid provides card advantage and removal. Find / Finality offers flexibility in recurring creatures or wiping the board if needed.

The main concept of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the game through counterspells, removals, and card draw until it can establish a win condition with powerful creatures like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, Crackling Drake, and Niv-Mizzet, Parun. This deck aims to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent by out-carding them. By efficiently managing threats and resources, the deck seeks to sweep the opponent's board with Deafening Clarion, counter key spells, and quickly close out the game with its powerful finishers.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures like Dauntless Bodyguard and Boros Challenger, supported by cards like Heroic Reinforcements and History of Benalia to boost their attacking power. It also includes removal spells like Lava Coil and Conclave Tribunal to deal with threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of aggressive creatures and create a fast clock to close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive Boros strategy with a mix of Mountains, Plains, Sacred Foundry, and Clifftop Retreat.

The main focus of this deck is to use Nexus of Fate to take extra turns and repeatedly activate Search for Azcanta to find combo pieces. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria is a key card for card advantage and control, while Karn, Scion of Urza provides additional card advantage. The deck includes plenty of card draw and ramp to help find and cast Nexus of Fate multiple times in a turn. The objective is to establish a lock on the game by taking infinite turns and overwhelming the opponent.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to ramp up mana quickly with Llanowar Elves and Druid of the Cowl, while also gaining life with Wildgrowth Walker and drawing cards with Midnight Reaper. The deck includes powerful threats like Carnage Tyrant and Ravenous Chupacabra to control the board and finish off opponents. Vivien Reid provides additional card advantage and removal. Find / Finality helps to recover from board wipes or find key cards. The deck also includes removal spells like Cast Down and Assassin's Trophy to deal with opponent's threats.

The main idea of this deck is to establish an aggressive board presence early on using efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Wildgrowth Walker, while also having the ability to control the board with removal spells like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt. The deck also aims to generate card advantage with cards like Midnight Reaper and Vivien Reid, while leveraging the strong late-game threats like Carnage Tyrant and Vivien. The Golgari Aggro deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creatures and removal spells, backed up by powerful planeswalkers like Vivien Reid.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria alongside efficient removal spells and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also includes win conditions like Crackling Drake and Niv-Mizzet, Parun to close out the game. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Deafening Clarion and Seal Away, while also drawing cards and generating card advantage with spells like Chemister's Insight and Opt. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and dictate the pace of the game through powerful control elements.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly flood the board with creatures and maintain a strong presence to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Adanto Vanguard and Venerated Loxodon, the deck can create a formidable army of creatures, while also benefiting from the powerful effects of cards like History of Benalia and March of the Multitudes. The deck aims to be aggressive and proactive, putting pressure on the opponent early on and generating value from its creatures and spells to secure victory.
